item.name: MongoDB::asserts::msg count
item.description: The number of message assertions raised since the MongoDB process started. Check the log file for more information about these messages.

item.name: MongoDB::asserts::regular count
item.description: The number of regular assertions raised since the MongoDB process started. Check the log file for more information about these messages.

item.name: MongoDB::asserts::rollovers count
item.description: The number of times that the rollover counters have rolled over since the last time the MongoDB process started. The counters will rollover to zero after 230 assertions. Use this value to provide context to the other values in the asserts data structure.

item.name: MongoDB::asserts::user count
item.description: The number of “user asserts” that have occurred since the last time the MongogDB process started. These are errors that user may generate, such as out of disk space or duplicate key. You can prevent these assertions by fixing a problem with your application or deployment. Check the MongoDB log for more information.

item.name: MongoDB::asserts::warning count
item.description: The number of warnings raised since the MongoDB process started. Check the log file for more information about these warnings.

item.name: MongoDB::connection::connection available
item.description: The number of unused incoming connections available. Consider this value in combination with the value of connections.current to understand the connection load on the database, and the UNIX ulimit Settings document for more information about system thresholds on available connections.

item.name: MongoDB::connection::current connection
item.description: The number of incoming connections from clients to the database server . This number includes the current shell session. Consider the value of connections.available to add more context to this datum.

item.name: MongoDB::connection::connection rate
item.description: Count of all incoming connections created to the server. This number includes connections that have since closed.

item.name: MongoDB::FsyncLock
item.description: Tells the user if the MongoDB has fsync lock enabled, this prevents write operations and is turned on during some maintenance scripts.

item.name: MongoDB::globalLock::activeClients::readers
item.description: The number of the active client connections performing read operations.

item.name: MongoDB::globalLock::activeClients::total
item.description: The total number of operations queued waiting for the lock (i.e., the sum of globalLock.currentQueue.readers and globalLock.currentQueue.writers).

item.name: MongoDB::globalLock::activeClients::writers
item.description: The number of active client connections performing write operations.

item.name: MongoDB::globalLock::lock time
item.description: The time, in microseconds, since the database last started and created the globalLock. This is roughly equivalent to total server uptime.

item.name: MongoDB::Hidden
item.description: Tells the user if the MongoDB is hidden, this means the database can write operations from other members, but won't server reads

item.name: MongoDB::memory::mappedWithJournal
item.description:
Only for the MMAPv1 storage engine.
The amount of mapped memory, in megabytes (MB), including the memory used for journaling. This value will always be twice the value of mem.mapped. This field is only included if journaling is enabled.

item.name: MongoDB::OplogLength
item.description: Describes the number of seconds that exist in the Oplog

item.name: MongoDB::OplogSync
item.description: Shows the number of seconds between the last operation in the oplog, and the the current time. This should be fairly accurate on a database that has continuous operations, but if the database doesn't do anything it will fall behind.

item.name: MongoDB::Priority
item.description: The current priority of this database, 0 means it cannot be elected as master. This is used as part of the hiding process

item.name: MongoDB::zabbix sender
item.description: A script to send mongodb stats

item_prototype.name: MongoDB::{#MONGODBNAME}::average object size
item_prototype.description: The average size of each document in bytes. This is the dataSize divided by the number of documents.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB::{#MONGODBNAME}::collection count
item_prototype.description: Contains a count of the number of collections in that database.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB::{#MONGODBNAME}::data size
item_prototype.description: The total size in bytes of the uncompressed data held in this database. The scale argument affects this value. The dataSize will decrease when you remove documents.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB::{#MONGODBNAME}::file size
item_prototype.description:
The total size in bytes of the data files that hold the database. This value includes preallocated space and the padding factor. The value of fileSize only reflects the size of the data files for the database and not the namespace file.
The scale argument affects this value. Only present when using the mmapv1 storage engine.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB::{#MONGODBNAME}::index count
item_prototype.description: Contains a count of the total number of indexes across all collections in the database.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB::{#MONGODBNAME}::index size
item_prototype.description: The total size in bytes of all indexes created on this database. The scale arguments affects this value.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB::{#MONGODBNAME}::namespace size
item_prototype.description:
The total size of the namespace files (i.e. that end with .ns) for this database. You cannot change the size of the namespace file after creating a database, but you can change the default size for all new namespace files with the nsSize runtime option.
Only present when using the mmapv1 storage engine.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB::{#MONGODBNAME}::extent count
item_prototype.description: Contains a count of the number of extents in the database across all collections.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB::{#MONGODBNAME}::object count
item_prototype.description: Contains a count of the number of objects (i.e. documents) in the database across all collections.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB::{#MONGODBNAME}::storage size
item_prototype.description: The total amount of space in bytes allocated to collections in this database for document storage. The scale argument affects this value. The storageSize does not decrease as you remove or shrink documents. This value may be smaller than dataSize for databases using the WiredTiger storage engine with compression enabled.

trigger.name: Locked, hidden and priority 0 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The database is locked, hidden and priority set to 0

trigger.name: Locked, hidden and priority 1 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The database is locked, hidden and priority set to 1

trigger.name: Locked, not hidden and priority 0 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The database is locked, hidden and priority set to 0

trigger.name: Locked, not hidden and priority 1 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The database is locked, not hidden and priority set to 1

trigger.name: MongoDB process is not running on {HOST.NAME}
MongoDB server status is not OK
MongoDB Wired Tiger Used cache 90% on {HOST.NAME}
MongoDB Wired Tiger Used cache 95% on {HOST.NAME}
Not locked, but is hidden and priority 0 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The database is not locked, but is hidden and priority set to 0

trigger.name: Not locked, is hidden and priority 1 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The database is not locked, is hidden and priority set to 1

trigger.name: Not locked or hidden, but priority 0 on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The database is not locked or hidden, but priority set to 0
